publicFunctions.argsString: (const thrust::detail::execution_policy_base< DerivedPolicy > &exec, ForwardIterator first, ForwardIterator last, InputIterator values_first, InputIterator values_last, OutputIterator result)
publicFunctions.details: lower_bound is a vectorized version of binary search: for each iterator v in [values_first, values_last) it attempts to find the value *v in an ordered range [first, last). Specifically, it returns the index of first position where value could be inserted without violating the ordering. The algorithm's execution is parallelized as determined by exec. The following code snippet demonstrates how to use lower_bound to search for multiple values in a ordered range using the thrust::device execution policy for parallelization: ```cpp #include #include #include ... thrust::device_vector input(5); input[0] = 0; input[1] = 2; input[2] = 5; input[3] = 7; input[4] = 8; thrust::device_vector values(6); values[0] = 0; values[1] = 1; values[2] = 2; values[3] = 3; values[4] = 8; values[5] = 9; thrust::device_vector output(6); thrust::lower_bound(thrust::device, input.begin(), input.end(), values.begin(), values.end(), output.begin()); // output is now [0, 1, 1, 2, 4, 5] ```
publicFunctions.name: lower_bound

paramList.name: exec
paramList.text: The execution policy to use for parallelization.

paramList.name: first
paramList.text: The beginning of the ordered sequence.

paramList.name: last
paramList.text: The end of the ordered sequence.

paramList.name: values_first
paramList.text: The beginning of the search values sequence.

paramList.name: values_last
paramList.text: The end of the search values sequence.

paramList.name: result
paramList.text: The beginning of the output sequence.

pre: The ranges [first,last) and [result, result + (last - first)) shall not overlap.

publicFunctions.details: lower_bound is a vectorized version of binary search: for each iterator v in [values_first, values_last) it attempts to find the value *v in an ordered range [first, last). Specifically, it returns the index of first position where value could be inserted without violating the ordering. This version of lower_bound uses function object comp for comparison. The algorithm's execution is parallelized as determined by exec. The following code snippet demonstrates how to use lower_bound to search for multiple values in a ordered range. ```cpp #include #include #include #include ... thrust::device_vector input(5); input[0] = 0; input[1] = 2; input[2] = 5; input[3] = 7; input[4] = 8; thrust::device_vector values(6); values[0] = 0; values[1] = 1; values[2] = 2; values[3] = 3; values[4] = 8; values[5] = 9; thrust::device_vector output(6); thrust::lower_bound(input.begin(), input.end(), values.begin(), values.end(), output.begin(), thrust::less()); // output is now [0, 1, 1, 2, 4, 5] ```

publicFunctions.details: binary_search is a vectorized version of binary search: for each iterator v in [values_first, values_last) it attempts to find the value *v in an ordered range [first, last). It returns true if an element that is equivalent to value is present in [first, last) and false if no such element exists. The algorithm's execution is parallelized as determined by exec. The following code snippet demonstrates how to use binary_search to search for multiple values in a ordered range using the thrust::device execution policy for parallelization: ```cpp #include #include #include ... thrust::device_vector input(5); input[0] = 0; input[1] = 2; input[2] = 5; input[3] = 7; input[4] = 8; thrust::device_vector values(6); values[0] = 0; values[1] = 1; values[2] = 2; values[3] = 3; values[4] = 8; values[5] = 9; thrust::device_vector output(6); thrust::binary_search(thrust::device, input.begin(), input.end(), values.begin(), values.end(), output.begin()); // output is now [true, false, true, false, true, false] ```
publicFunctions.name: binary_search

paramList.name: exec
paramList.text: The execution policy to use for parallelization.

paramList.text: The beginning of the ordered sequence.

paramList.text: The beginning of the search values sequence.

paramList.text: The beginning of the output sequence.
